overview: This Act shall be known and may be cited as the Judiciary Appropriations Act of 2025. [1] This bill appropriates funds for the Judiciary for the fiscal biennium beginning 7/1/2025, and ending 6/30/2027. [1] The measure appropriates or authorizes sums from specified funding sources to accomplish the purposes and programs designated for the judiciary. [1]
appropriations: The bill appropriates funds to the judiciary for the fiscal biennium beginning July 1, 2025, and ending June 30, 2027. [1] This includes operating funds for various judicial circuits and programs, such as JUD101 - Courts of Appeal and JUD310 - First Circuit. [1] It also appropriates $9,900,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) in general obligation bond funds for capital investment projects. [CHUNK_11, NUMBER_0]
assumptions_and_methodology: The appropriations are specified for various Program IDs within the judicial system for each year of the fiscal biennium. [1] The total expenditures and the number of permanent and temporary positions established in each fiscal year shall not exceed the sums and the position ceilings indicated for each year, except as provided in this Act. [1] The methodology involves appropriating or authorizing sums from specified sources of funding for designated programs. [1]
agency_impact: The Judiciary is appropriated funds for its operations and capital improvement projects for the fiscal biennium 2025-2027. [1] The chief justice may transfer sufficient funds and positions between programs for operating purposes. [1] The judiciary may also delegate the planning, acquisition of land, design, construction, and equipment of any capital improvement project to other state or county agencies when it is determined to be advantageous. [1]
economic_impact: The appropriated funds support the operations of the state's judicial system. [1] Capital improvement projects, including plans and design for a new judiciary complex in South Kohala and upgrades to facilities statewide, are expected to generate economic activity through construction and procurement. [1] [1] The total funding for capital projects is $9,900,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt). [CHUNK_15, NUMBER_0]
policy_impact: This Act serves as the judiciary's budget for the 2025-2027 fiscal biennium. [1] It grants the chief justice authority to transfer funds between programs, enter into undertakings with federal or private entities for additional funding, and manage capital improvement projects. [1] [1] [1] The Act also allows for supplemental allotments for capital projects from the judiciary project adjustment fund. [1]
revenue_sources: The means of financing for the appropriations include General funds (A), Special funds (B), General obligation bond funds (C), and Revolving funds (W). [1] The capital improvement projects are funded by $9,900,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) from General obligation bond funds. [CHUNK_11, NUMBER_0] The chief justice may also secure federal funds or funds from private organizations. [1]
six_year_fiscal_implications: This bill provides appropriations for the fiscal biennium beginning July 1, 2025, and ending June 30, 2027. [1] For fiscal year 2025-2026, operating appropriations include $9,592,659 (A) for the Courts of Appeal and $98,130,866 (A) for the First Circuit. [1] For fiscal year 2026-2027, these appropriations are $9,657,093 (A) and $98,298,808 (A) respectively. [1] The Administration program (JUD601) is appropriated $41,193,756 (A) and $8,241,219 (B) for FY 2026, and $41,042,866 (A) and $8,241,219 (B) for FY 2027. [1] A one-time capital investment appropriation of $9,900,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) from general obligation bond funds is made for FY 2026. [CHUNK_11, NUMBER_0] These operating costs are recurring and would likely continue in subsequent biennia to maintain judiciary functions. [1] The bill establishes position ceilings for permanent and temporary employees for the two-year period. [1] Capital improvement appropriations that are unencumbered as of June 30, 2028, will lapse. [1] No fiscal projections beyond June 30, 2027 are provided in the act. [1]
operating_revenue_impact: The bill primarily appropriates funds and does not focus on revenue generation. [1] It authorizes expenditures from various fund types, including special and revolving funds. [1] The bill allows the chief justice to secure federal funds or funds from private organizations to be expended in connection with authorized programs. [1]

fte_positions: The bill establishes a "Position ceiling," which is the maximum number of permanent or temporary positions authorized for a particular program. [1] For the First Circuit (JUD310), the position ceiling for each year of the biennium is 1,115.50 permanent and 57.58 temporary positions. [1] For Administration (JUD601), the ceilings are 234.50 permanent and 8.48 temporary positions from general funds, with an additional 1.00 permanent and 9.00 temporary positions from other funds. [1]

department_impact: The bill appropriates funds directly to the judiciary for the purposes and programs designated. [1] No changes in departmental responsibility for expending appropriations are mentioned. [1]
reports_required: If any manifest clerical, typographical, or other mechanical error is found in this Act, the chief justice may correct the error. [1] All changes made pursuant to this section shall be reported to the legislature at its next regular session. [1]

sunset_date: The bill does not contain a sunset clause for the entire act. [1] However, all appropriations made for fiscal year 2025-2026 and fiscal year 2026-2027 that are unencumbered as of June 30, 2028, shall lapse as of that date. [1]
effective_date: This Act shall take effect on July 1, 2025. [1]
